column4: Can anyone else help me with my NTFS issue? I already corrected my fstab.. just got to get it to mount properly I get.. mount: special device /dev/disk/by-uuid/0FAFFE6303FAF196 does not exist  when trying mount -a
does that path exist?  (it's case sensitive too)
i have no idea why mount -a is spewing that out. so i doubt it does exist
all i did was type mount -a
sure lemme find the link again
cwillu replace the umask with an f and move ro over so there is no space.
can you now pastebin me what " ls /dev/disk/by-path/ " says?
I'm not dead sure, but I'd guess that if you change /etc/fstab ->  UUID=0FAFFE6303FAF196 to  UUID=8E08A5D008A5B81B it'll work, but I'm not dead sure
it you're sure there's nothing using it, just delete the lock file
